result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan Joseph Patrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Logan Joseph Patrick is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Logan Joseph Patrick was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Logan Joseph Patrick in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 14CF487 & 14CF111.  Rights/Elements. In 14CF111 defendant plead no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include $518.00 costs, AODA and comply.  6 month periodic review.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after two years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.   In 14CF487 defendant pled no contest to Ct. 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 1 dismissed.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 days jail, 4 days of jail credit.  Court considered time served.  $705.00 fines and costs.  Any bond on hand is to be applied towards costs and fine.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.
plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2015 at 2:45 p.m.

Defendant Logan Joseph Patrick in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the  State of Wisconsin.   Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. Twenty days to file motions.

Defendant Logan Joseph Patrick in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.

Defendant, Logan Joseph Patrick, appeared. Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant would like time to get an Atty.  Atty Masana does represent the defendant in 14CF11.  Atty Masana is present in courtroom.  Atty Masana requested a reset of the preliminary hearing.  Bond remains.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Logan Joseph Patrick, appeared with attorney Adam Raabe, special for the public defender office. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed. $300 cash bond set with felony conds. Time limits not waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Warrant issued due to Defendant's failure to appear for court hearing/pretrial on Dec. 11, 2014
Defendant Logan Joseph Patrick not in Court.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requested a warrant.  Warrant authorized forthwith.

Defendant Logan Joseph Patrick by video, in custody with attorney Alicia Marie Nall.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $1000.00 signature bond. Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 02:10 pm.  Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
